content: Introduction of previous research.
A few algorithms questions, some system design, and general open ended questions (i.e. how would you try to bring growth to the company).
Write SQL queries to find the daily active users and daily churn given user activity tables that record the times when users performed actions on the website.
Why Huawei?
answer:
Ans=====
 Proud to be a psr of the winning team.

content: Tell us a project you worked on.
DS, Cloud, Programming language.
Standard interview questions and questions about past projects etc.
answer:
Ans=====
 Huawei made an offer and then tried the tactic of bait and switch, going back and forth tried to lower the compensation and job title and then tried to hire me as a contractor. The company lacks ethics and constantly was trying to get to low ball me to save money. Very unprofessional HR and bad ethics. They also have history of stealing products of other companies and building their own on the basis of that. One example is that they stole Cisco router code and started packaging as their own and sold it in south east Asia market. They have a judgement against them out here in United States too.

content: How would you handle a situation in where your supervisor was wrong?
why do you want to work here?
Draw the UMTS architecture and explain.
answer:
Ans=====
 Draw a schematic diagram of UMTS architecture and explained interfaces and functions.

content: Implement LRU cache
answer:
Ans=====
 I was able to whiteboard an LRU cache implementation using hashtable and DLL. However the interviewer was arrogant and kept saying "this wouldn't work". When I explained with an example, he said "its not thread safe" and kept going into tangential topics. We ended with CAP theorem and options to make it thread safe. He made statements like "you never prepared for this interview, did you?" and "you guys are never ready for a good interview" when I turned back from the whiteboard. Overall very bad experience interviewing here, I highly recommend you not to answer recruiter calls from this company. They are unprofessional and arrogant.

content: "Tell me about yourself"
Tell me about yourself.
If you could meet anyone, who would you want to meet and why?
What do you need to have a successful working environment?
What is your experience with Philanthropy? What is your personal connection to Make A Wish?
What are your strengths/weaknesses?
What are your strong skills?
A little girls wishes to be a princess. Her favorite color is pink and she loves sparkles. How would you plan this wish?
What are you looking for in a supervisor?
What is your experience working with databases?
They were very interested to know how my previous professional experience would help them at this particular moment in the area of consumer robotics.
No questions were out of the ordinary. I was asked what I know about Make-A-Wish, why I chose a career in accounting, etc.
Specific to job
Your strength and weakness
1. Technical questions related to your field
What's the difference between TCP and UDP
If you could have a wish, what would it be?
How would you deal with edge latency in a virtualized RAN environment?
Describe how a centralized queue management system could be used for streaming communications.
Why Make a Wish?

Why do you want to work at Make-a-Wish? What are you strengths and weaknesses? What do you want to do with your future (in regard to your career)? What do you know about the foundation and our mission? thoroughly researched the company and position to prepare for the interview which was fairly easy overall.

can you find a bug here? (Shown a simple mobile app bug)

what are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?
What software have I used before? What's my learning style? Describe my job experience.
china team asked every thing in my resume, so be prepare to answer any questions on the domains mentioned in resume.
Behavioral questions about your resume experiences. What kind of people you have worked with on a team? What is your weakness and strength? How do you reconcile the disagreements between teammates?
Why I want to work for make a wish
merge two sorted array
What is one area where you feel you're an expert in?
How to implement a frequency divider with division ratio 2 by a flip-flop
Your background is not matched, why do you think you are competent?
There were no one-on-one interviews, just the group meeting in which I gave the talk. They asked technical questions on the material I presented.
answer:
Ans=====
 I answered the questions as they were raised, no major problems.

What you did at previous jobs. They want to know if you understand what there doing already and if you have anything to offer them.

 It was easy because Ive been doing it for 10 years. I brought samples of real time work that was better then anything they were producing. So it was an easy win.

content: I was a bit scared, because I had an interview with HR employee, department manager and then store manager.
none were difficult or unexpected
The questions were easy. None of them caught me by surprise.
why did I want the position and my experience
How would you deal with a veteran employee
Hour available to work - Seasonal position
If a customer insists the price was different than it scannerd, what would you do?
answer:
Ans=====
 Verify with the proper department the correct price. Inventory accuracy is important. The customer will then be given the option to purchase or set it aside.

content: Questions were very general. For instance, "Why Boscov's?, What makes you qualified? If you were in this situation... what would you do?"

answer:

 Yes, I have been told by friends and family I am creative but I would like to hone my skills in the event designer world.
